answers.answer: I am not a doctor, but I believe the eCO2 blood test is a blood gas test used to measure how much oxygen and carbon dioxide is in your blood.  Low CO2 levels can be due to low acid levels in your blood.  Some conditions that can cause this are diabetes, kidney disease, metabolic disorders, or hyperventilation.  I don’t know if zero on your lab results means they did not check your carbon dioxide level or if it is low.  If your doctor doesn’t know, can you call your lab and ask for more information? On the other hand, if your doctor isn't worried about this result, then it is probably nothing to worry about.  Congratulations on being UND at the end of 4 months.Advocate1955
Great news about your 4 month UND!  Make sure to question your Doctor about that lab result. Doctors are very busy, so we cant assume they dont make human errors, etc.

I've asked about those odd things like MCV and such and generally get told not to worry. So I don't :)If everything else is good, then don't worry about a little fluctuation in some odd blood level about some part of your blood.

At end of  treatment   AST and   ALT  had come down  from over 500 to ALT was 65 normal .AST was   70 still little high.MCV  99.0      little high should been in range of         76.0- 90.0MCH  33.4      little high should be in range of             25.0- 31.0All  other was normalStill UND at end of 4 months I  go back last part Dec for rest of blood work and I have  been off all medications since last part JuneThis is one I dont understand it isEC02   it was 0--- should be in range of   21.0--32.0 never does show any amt just 0I ask my Dr what it was she  said  I do not know...........Thanks for any imputbbj
